subject: Re: [junit] How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: Elliotte Harold wrote:  ... OK. Does the client programmer want a nice API that doesn t work, or a slightly less nice API that does? You continue to
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:

<snip />
> Usable APIs need to place
> the needs of the user ahead of the needs of the original developer.

OK. Does the client programmer want a nice API that doesn't work, or a
slightly less nice API that does? You continue to make it sound like a
method here or there is irreversible, unwieldy pollution. It just isn't.

<snip />
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
